SummaryEnglish: The stories that lie within the cards come to life...

1.TitleEnglish: Sky Striker Ace I: "Sky Striker Ace - Raye"
1.SummaryEnglish: To counter the great powers surrounding the mighty empire, the "Sky Striker" was developed using advanced military technology. Its power was enough to instantly change the course of battle. The girl "Raye," entrusted with the "Sky Striker," repeatedly encounters the girl "Roze" from the hostile nation wielding equal power on the battlefield. Each time they clash with the "Sky Striker," Raye gradually gets a glimpse of the "human heart" within Roze and rises up to free her! To meet Roze not as a "weapon" but as a "person"---

2.TitleEnglish: "Sky Striker Ace II: Sky Striker Ace - Roze"
2.SummaryEnglish: The Fallen & The Virtuous I: ”Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous”

3.TitleEnglish: The Fallen & The Virtuous I: ”Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous”
3.SummaryEnglish: In the northern most reaches of a forbidden land, lies the Nation of Dogmatika. Its people, marked by the sacred stigmata bestowed by High Priest Maximus, live beneath the unwavering rule of divine doctrine. Receiving the High Priest’s blessing on that day was Ecclesia, the “Most Virtuous,” the only one in history to bear the stigmata on her forehead. After the ceremony, Ecclesia stood alongside the previous Virtuous Vestal, “Fleurdelis,” speaking in earnest about what’s to come — when suddenly, the skies above Dogmatika split open. From the rift emerged a beast thought to exist only in legend — a dragon. Amid the flames of war, a fallen dragon boy and a wary girl cross paths. From their fated encounter begins the tale of the fallen and the virtuous.

4.TitleEnglish: The Fallen & The Virtuous II: "Dogmatika Fleurdelis, the Knighted"
4.SummaryEnglish: A single dragon suddenly appeared in the skies above the great Nation of "Dogmatika," only to be felled in a flash by the knight "Fleurdelis," hailed as the "Indomitable Vestal." At that very moment, agents from the opposition faction, "Tri-Brigade," infiltrated the heart of Dogmatika territory. Their leader, "Shuraig," launches a daring solitary aerial assault, aiming to distract Fleurdelis and buy time for the rescue of their captured comrades. Meanwhile, at the crash site of the fallen dragon, the "Ecclesia" discovers a wounded boy. Wishing to help him, Ecclesia throws herself between the Dogmatika forces and the Tri-Brigade soldiers, trying desperately to halt the clash.
